sen.j: 税所 篤（さいしょ あつし、文政10年11月5日 (旧暦)（1827年12月22日）- 明治43年（1910年）6月21日）は、日本の武士、官僚。
sen.e: Atsushi SAISHO (December 22, 1827-June 21, 1910) was a Japanese samurai warrior and a bureaucrat.
Atsushi SAISHO (December 22, 1827-June 21, 1910) was a Japanese samurai warrior and a bureaucrat.
Atsushi SAISHO (December 22, 1827-June 21, 1910) was a Japanese samurai warrior and a bureaucrat.

sen.j: 子爵。
sen.e: A viscount
He was a viscount
He was a viscount

sen.j: 通称は喜三左衛門、長蔵。
sen.e: The common name was Kizaemon or Chozo.
His common name was Kizaemon or Chozo.
His common name was Kizaemon or Chozo.

sen.j: 号は巌舎。
sen.e: His pseudonym was Gansha.
His pseudonym was Gansha.
His pseudonym was Gansha.

sen.j: 薩摩藩士・税所篤倫の二男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Atsumichi SAISHO, the a feudal retainer of Satsuma.
He was born as the second son of Atsumichi SAISHO, a feudal retainer of Satsuma.
sen.cmt: コンマの後のtheの削除しました。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Atsumichi SAISHO, a feudal retainer of Satsuma.

sen.j: 若くして国学者・平田篤胤の門下となり、藩主島津斉彬に認められて勘定所郡方に任じられた。
sen.e: When he was young, he learned at Atsutane HIRATA, a scholar of Japanese classical literature, and was recognized by Nariakira SHIMAZU, the lord of Satsuma Domain and appointed a county accounting officer.

When he was young, he learned at Atsutane HIRATA, a scholar of Japanese classical literature, and was recognized by Nariakira SHIMAZU, the lord of Satsuma Domain and appointed a county accounting officer.

When he was young, he learned at Atsutane HIRATA, a scholar of Japanese classical literature, and was recognized by Nariakira SHIMAZU, the lord of Satsuma Domain and appointed a county accounting officer.

sen.j: 改革派である精忠組に加わり、西郷隆盛や大久保利通、吉井幸輔らと親交を深めた。
sen.e: He joined Seichugumi Organization, a reform group, and deepened relationship with Takamori SAIGO, Toshimichi OKUBO, Kosuke YOSHII and others.
He joined Seichugumi Organization, a reform group, and deepened relationship with Takamori SAIGO, Toshimichi OKUBO, Kosuke YOSHII and others.
He joined Seichugumi Organization, a reform group, and deepened relationship with Takamori SAIGO, Toshimichi OKUBO, Kosuke YOSHII and others.

sen.j: 禁門の変以後は、西郷の片腕として活躍する。
sen.e: After Kimmon no Hen (Conspiracy of Kinmon), he was active as Saigo's right hand.
After Kimmon no Hen (Conspiracy of Kinmon), he was active as Saigo's right hand.
After Kimmon no Hen (Conspiracy of Kinmon), he was active as Saigo's right hand.

sen.j: 第一次長州征伐では長州藩の降伏における処理に務めた。
sen.e: In the First conquest of Choshu he dealt with the transaction in the surrender of Choshu Domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the First conquest of Choshu he dealt with the transaction in the surrender of Choshu Domain.
In the First conquest of Choshu he dealt with the transaction in the surrender of Choshu Domain.

sen.j: 戊辰戦争では大坂にあって新政府軍の軍事費などの財政処理を務めた。
sen.e: In Boshin Civil War he was engaged in the financial transactions of New government including army's military expenditure.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Boshin Civil War he was engaged in the financial transactions of New government including army's military expenditure.
In Boshin Civil War he was engaged in the financial transactions of New government including army's military expenditure.

sen.j: 新政府では内国事務権判事、河内県・兵庫県・奈良県・堺県の各県令・知事を歴任する。
sen.e: In the new government he served various positions such as internal office judge and the governor of Kawachi, Hyogo, Nara Sakai Prefecture.
In the new government he served various positions such as internal office judge and the governor of Kawachi, Hyogo, Nara and Sakai Prefectures.
In the new government he served various positions such as internal office judge and the governor of Kawachi, Hyogo, Nara and Sakai Prefectures.

sen.j: 1877年の西南戦争では、明治天皇の奈良行幸における事務や吉野宮造営の建議などを行っており、西南戦争に関与しておらず罪に問われることはなかった。
sen.e: At the Seinan War he was not accused of a crime because he had not been involved in the war, having been involved in the secretary work of the Imperial visit to Nara and proposal of construction of Yoshino no miya Shrine.

At the Seinan War he was not accused of a crime because he had not been involved in the war, having been involved in the secretary work of the Imperial visit to Nara and proposal of construction of Yoshino no miya Shrine.

At the Seinan War he was not accused of a crime because he had not been involved in the war, having been involved in the secretary work of the Imperial visit to Nara and proposal of construction of Yoshino no miya Shrine.

sen.j: 古美術の鑑定を得意としていたことから、正倉院御物の整理掛に就任。
sen.e: He took in charge of classification of artifacts in Shoso-in gyobutsu (Shoso-in's Imperial Property) because he was good at appraising antiquities.
He took in charge of classification of artifacts in Shoso-in gyobutsu (Shoso-in's Imperial Property) because he was good at appraising antiquities.
He took in charge of classification of artifacts in Shoso-in gyobutsu (Shoso-in's Imperial Property) because he was good at appraising antiquities.

sen.j: のちに霧島神宮の宮司、枢密顧問官を務めた。
sen.e: Later he served the Guji (chief of those who serves shrine, controls festivals and general affairs) of Kirishima-jingu Shrine and the privy councilor.
Later he served the Guji (chief of those who serves shrine, controls festivals and general affairs) of Kirishima-jingu Shrine and a Privy Councilor.
sen.cmt: the privy councilor→a Privy Councilorの変更をしました。
sen.e: Later he served the Guji (chief of those who serves shrine, controls festivals and general affairs) of Kirishima-jingu Shrine and a Privy Councilor.

sen.j: 1887年、維新の功により子爵を授けられる。
sen.e: With the merits at the Meiji Restoration, he was given the position of viscount.
With the merits at the Meiji Restoration, he was given the position of viscount.
With the merits at the Meiji Restoration, he was given the position of viscount.
He died in 1910.
He died in 1910.
He died in 1910.

sen.j: 享年84。
sen.e: His age at death was 84.
His age at death was 84.
His age at death was 84.

sen.j: 西郷が月照と共に入水自殺を図った際、奇跡的に助かった西郷の看病を務めた。
sen.e: He cared for Saigo who had committed suicide by drowning with Gessho and miraculously survived.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He cared for Saigo who had committed suicide by drowning with Gessho and miraculously survived.
He cared for Saigo who had committed suicide by drowning with Gessho and miraculously survived.

sen.j: 文久2年（1862年）には、奄美大島流罪の西郷召還を大久保とともに島津久光に嘆願している。
sen.e: In 1862 he and Okubo petitioned Hisamitsu SHIMAZU for the release and return of Saigo who had been exiled to Amami-oshima Island to the domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1862 he and Okubo petitioned Hisamitsu SHIMAZU for the release and return of Saigo who had been exiled to Amami-oshima Island to the domain.
In 1862 he and Okubo petitioned Hisamitsu SHIMAZU for the release and return of Saigo who had been exiled to Amami-oshima Island to the domain.

sen.j: 堺県令時代に浜寺公園内の松を伐採して開発しようとする。
sen.e: He tried to cut down the pine trees in Hamadera-koen Park and develop the land.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He tried to cut down the pine trees in Hamadera-koen Park and develop the land.
He tried to cut down the pine trees in Hamadera-koen Park and develop the land.

sen.j: だが、大久保に反対する歌を詠まれて断念した。
sen.e: However, he dropped the plan in the face of the Okubo's opposing tanka (a Japanese poem) to his plan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, he dropped the plan in the face of the Okubo's opposing tanka (a Japanese poem) to his plan.
However, he dropped the plan in the face of the Okubo's opposing tanka (a Japanese poem) to his plan.

sen.j: 子に篤一、篤三、岩佐ナミがいる。
sen.e: He had three children: Atsuhito, Atsumi and Nami IWASA.
sen.cmt: 「篤一」「篤三」の読みは推測です
sen.e: He had three children: Atsuhito, Atsumi and Nami IWASA.
He had three children: Atsuhito, Atsumi and Nami IWASA.

sen.j: なお、篤一の次女・サワは大久保の六男・大久保駿熊に嫁ぐ。
sen.e: In addition, Atsuhito's second daughter Sawa married Hayakuma OKUBO, the sixth son of Toshimichi OKUBO.
In addition, Atsuhito's second daughter Sawa married Hayakuma OKUBO, the sixth son of Toshimichi OKUBO.
In addition, Atsuhito's second daughter Sawa married Hayakuma OKUBO, the sixth son of Toshimichi OKUBO.

sen.j: 実兄は吉祥院乗願で、囲碁を通じて大久保を島津久光に紹介したことで知られる。
sen.e: Jogan of Kissho-in Temple is his real brother, who is known for introducing Okubo to Hisamitsu SHIMAZU.
Jogan of Kissho-in Temple is his real brother, who is known for introducing Okubo to Hisamitsu SHIMAZU.
Jogan of Kissho-in Temple is his real brother, who is known for introducing Okubo to Hisamitsu SHIMAZU.
